sen.j: 談林派（だんりんは）は、西山宗因らを中心にして江戸時代に栄えた俳諧の一派。
sen.e: Danrin-ha is a Haikai (seventeen-syllable verse) school in the Edo period, which flourished with Soin NISHIYAMAtaking the lead.

sen.j: 松永貞徳門下による貞門派に代わって俳壇の中心を占めた。
sen.e: It held the central place in Haidan (the world of the haiku)replacing the Teimon-ha (Teimon school of the haiku)led by the disciples of Teitoku MATSUNAGA.

sen.j: 連歌師でもあった西山宗因のほか、浮世草子作者でもある井原西鶴、京の菅野谷高政、江戸の田代松意らが活躍した。
sen.e: Soin NISHIYAMA who was also a Rengashi (linked verse poet), Saikaku IHARA who was also an author of Ukiyo Zoshi (stories of the floating world), Takamasa SUGANOYA of Kyoto, Shoi TASHIRO of Edo and so on actively participated.

sen.j: 後に衰えて松尾芭蕉による蕉風が盛んになる。
sen.e: It waned later and Shofu (Basho style of the haiku) by Basho MATSUO became active.
